articles.title: Gunman Kills 5 People in Midtown Manhattan Skyscraper, Including Himself
articles.description: A gunman opened fire in a Midtown Manhattan skyscraper, killing four people before taking his own life. The shooter, identified as 27-year-old Shane Tamura from Las Vegas, had a history of mental health issues and referenced CTE in a suicide note. The attack occurred in a building that housed NFL offices, and the shooter may have targeted them.

articles.title: Global Hunger Monitor Warns Israel's Siege on Gaza Has Led to “Worst-Case Scenario of Famine”
articles.description: A UN-backed hunger monitoring group has warned of a "worst-case scenario of famine" in Gaza due to Israel's siege, with widespread starvation and malnutrition driving a rise in hunger-related deaths. The Integrated Food Security Phase Classification states that unimpeded, large-scale humanitarian aid is crucial to prevent further deaths. President Trump has acknowledged seeing images of starving children in Gaza, breaking from Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu's denial of starvation.

articles.title: UK to Recognize Palestinian State Unless Israel Agrees to Ceasefire
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced that the UK will recognize a Palestinian state if Israel does not commit to ending the war in Gaza. This statement comes as aid trucks continue to enter Gaza and humanitarian airdrops are permitted, though aid groups state it is insufficient.
